page.title: 11PUBLIC TRANSPORT.
page.content: The area is not directly served by passenger railways,the nearest British Rail stations being at Lichfield and Walsall.The West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive (WMPTE) provides a service to Walsall via Brownhills,and Burntwood.Until May 1985 this service also covered Lichfield.WMPTE have had to defend their decision to curtail the service following protests in the local press.The service runs every half hour weekdays and once an hour on Sundays.It starts early morning and finishes late at night.A single adult fare to Walsall,distance 8 miles,costs 85p. Chaserider buses,operated by Midland Red North run three local services on weekdays.The most frequent service runs from Lichfield to Cannock hourly. Adult single to Lichfield,6 miles costs 75p from Chasetown centre.
